stanza.line: Not from the stars do I my judgement pluckpluck
And yet methinks I have astronomyastronomy
But not to tell of good or evil luckluck
Of plagues of dearths or seasons qualityquality
Nor can I fortune to brief minutes telltell
Pointing to each his thunder rain and windwind
Or say with princes if it shall go wellwell
By oft predict that I in heaven findfind
But from thine eyes my knowledge I derivederive
And constant stars in them I read such artart
As truth and beauty shall together thrivethrive
If from thy self to store thou wouldst convertconvert
Or else of thee this I prognosticateprognosticate
Thy end is truth and beauty doom and datedate
